fields.name: Mojito
fields.description: Mix this classic cocktail for a party using fresh mint, white rum, sugar, zesty lime and cooling soda water. Play with the quantities to suit your taste.
fields.ingredients_three: small handful mint leaves, plus extra sprig to serve
fields.instructions_one: Muddle the lime juice, sugar and mint leaves in a small jug, crushing the mint as you go – you can use the end of a rolling pin for this. Pour into a tall glass and add a handful of ice.
fields.instructions_two: Pour over the rum, stirring with a long-handled spoon. Top up with soda water, garnish with mint and serve.

fields.name: Sex on the beach cocktail
fields.description: Combine vodka with peach schnapps and cranberry juice to make a classic sex on the beach cocktail. Garnish with cocktail cherries and orange slices
fields.ingredients_three: 2 oranges, juiced, plus 2 slices to garnish
fields.instructions_one: Fill two tall glasses with ice cubes. Pour the vodka, peach schnapps and fruit juices into a large jug and stir.
fields.instructions_two: Divide the mixture between the two glasses and stir gently to combine. Garnish with the cocktail cherries and orange slices.

fields.name: Rhubarb gin
fields.description: Use seasonal rhubarb to make this G&T-with-a-difference, or top the finished gin with soda water for a refreshing and gloriously pink summertime drink
fields.ingredients_two: 400g caster sugar (don't use golden - it muddies the colour)
fields.instructions_one: Wash the rhubarb, trim the stalks and discard the base and any leaves. Cut the stalks into 3cm lengths. Put in a large jar with the sugar. Shake everything around, put the lid on and leave overnight. The sugar will draw the juice out of the rhubarb.
fields.instructions_two: After 24 hrs, add the gin, seal and shake everything around. Leave for about 4 weeks before drinking. You can strain the liquor off through a muslin-lined sieve and transfer to a bottle, but I often just leave the rhubarb and booze in the jar and ladle it into drinks that way. Over time the rhubarb

fields.name: Espresso martini
fields.description: Learn how to make this classic coffee cocktail. Our easy recipe uses freshly brewed espresso, a dash of coffee liqueur and a simple sugar syrup.
fields.instructions_one: STEP 1 Start by making the sugar syrup. Put the caster sugar in a small pan over a medium heat and pour in 50ml water. Stir, and bring to the boil.
fields.instructions_two: STEP 2 Turn off the heat and allow the mixture to cool. Put 2 martini glasses in the fridge to chill.
fields.instructions_three: STEP 3 Once the sugar syrup is cold, pour 1 tbsp into a cocktail shaker along with a handful of ice, the vodka, espresso and coffee liqueur. Shake until the outside of the cocktail shaker feels icy cold.
fields.instructions_four: STEP 4 Strain into the chilled glasses. Garnish each one with coffee beans if you like.

fields.name: Mulled gin
fields.description: Infuse apple juice with festive spices to make this Christmassy gin cocktail
fields.ingredients_four: 1 small cinnamon stick, 1 tsp runny honey
fields.ingredients_five: ½ tsp coriander seeds, 3 juniper berries, lightly crushed
fields.instructions_one: Divide the gin between four small heatproof glasses or teacups.
fields.instructions_two: Tip the apple juice into a saucepan with the rest of the ingredients. Heat gently until simmering, then strain into a jug. Pour the mulled apple juice into the glasses with the gin and stir gently to combine. Garnish each glass with a bay leaf and half a lemon slice and serve warm.

fields.name: Palomezcal
fields.description: Try a twist on one of Mexico's favourite cocktails using mezcal instead of tequila for a refreshing, summery sipper
fields.instructions_one: STEP 1 If you're choosing to salt the rim of your glass like a classic margarita, dip the rim in a saucer of lime juice, followed by a saucer of sea salt.
fields.instructions_two: Put all the ingredients except the soda water into a cocktail shaker, fill with ice and give it a good shake.
fields.instructions_three: Method STEP 1 If you're choosing to salt the rim of your glass like a classic margarita, dip the rim in a saucer of lime juice, followed by a saucer of sea salt.  STEP 2 Put all the ingredients except the soda water into a cocktail shaker, fill with ice and give it a good shake.  STEP 3 Strain into

fields.name: Easy sangria
fields.description: Embrace balmy summer days with a jug of sangria. With red wine, Spanish brandy, sparkling water, cinnamon and chopped fruit, it's a lovely sharing cocktail
fields.ingredients_four: 200g red berries , chopped (we used strawberries and cherries)
fields.instructions_one: Put the chopped fruit in a bowl and sprinkle over the sugar and cinnamon, then stir to coat. Cover and leave to macerate in the fridge for at least 1 hr, or ideally overnight.
fields.instructions_two: Fill a large jug with ice. Stir the macerated fruit mixture to ensure the sugar is dissolved, then tip into the jug with the wine and brandy. Stir, then top up with the sparkling water and serve.

fields.name: Singapore sling
fields.description: Mix gin with cherry brandy, Benedictine, Angostura bitters, pineapple and lime juice to make this classic cocktail. Garnish with pineapple and a cherry
fields.ingredients_three: 25ml Benedictine, sparkling water to top up
fields.instructions_one: Pour the gin, cherry brandy and Benedictine into a mixing glass or a jug. Add the ice and Angostura bitters. Stir well until the outside of the glass feels cold.
fields.instructions_two: Pour the mix into a tall glass, then add the pineapple juice and lime juice and stir gently. Top up with sparkling water and garnish.

fields.name: Mudslide
fields.description: Share this creamy adults-only drink with the chocolate lover in your life. For extra indulgence, grate over some chocolate before serving
fields.instructions_one: Put two small tumblers in the fridge to chill overnight. Put 30g of the chocolate in a shallow bowl and melt in the microwave in short bursts. Dip the rim of the chilled glasses in the melted chocolate, then stand them upright so it gradually drips down the sides. Return to the fridge until you're r
fields.instructions_two: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then pour in the coffee-flavoured liqueur, vodka, Irish cream liqueur and double cream. Shake until the outside of the shaker is very cold.
fields.instructions_three: Put a few ice cubes in the prepared glasses, then strain in the cocktail. Finely grate over the remaining chocolate and serve with a paper straw.

fields.name: Aperol spritz
fields.description: Get a taste of summer with our take on this classic Italian cocktail of Aperol, prosecco and soda. Try our proportions or adjust the ratio to taste
fields.instructions_one: Put a couple of cubes of ice into 2 glasses and add a 50 ml measure of Aperol to each. Divide the prosecco between the glasses and then top up with soda, if you like.

fields.name: Pink gin iced tea
fields.description: Blend pink gin with iced tea and you have this unique cocktail, made with spiced rum, elderflower and pink grapefruit. Serve in a jug for a sharing cocktail
fields.ingredients_five: 100ml pink grapefruit juice, thyme sprigs, to garnish
fields.instructions_one: Brew the chamomile tea bag with 500ml boiling water, steep for 2-3 mins or following pack instructions. Remove the bag and leave to cool for 5 mins.
fields.instructions_two: Pour into a large jug with the pink gin, rum, elderflower cordial and juice. Add ice and stir, then add the thyme sprigs and stir again before serving.

fields.name: Hurricane cocktail
fields.description: Our tropical, rum-based hurricane cocktail is easy to make and sure to get your party started. Garnish with orange and cocktail cherries for a kitsch touch
fields.instructions_one: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice then add the rums. Scoop the flesh and seeds from the passion fruit and add to the shaker along with the orange and lemon juices, sugar syrup and grenadine.
fields.instructions_two: Shake well until the outside of the cocktail shaker feels icy cold. Fill two hurricane glasses with fresh ice then double strain the drink into the prepared glasses.
fields.instructions_three: Garnish each one with an orange slice skewered onto a cocktail stick and a couple of cocktail cherries.

fields.name: Pink negroni
fields.description: Go pink with this fabulous cocktail flavoured with pink gin, rose vermouth and Aperol. Garnish with a wedge of pink grapefruit and a basil leaf to serve
fields.ingredients_two: 25ml rose vermouth , or sweet white vermouth
fields.ingredients_four: wedge of pink grapefruit and a basil leaf, to garnish
fields.instructions_one: Combine the pink gin, vermouth and Aperol in a tumbler with a small handful of ice. Stir until the outside of the glass feels cold.
fields.instructions_two: Garnish with a wedge of pink grapefruit and a basil leaf.

fields.name: Vodka martini
fields.description: Make an easy vodka martini with our simple recipe for an elegant party tipple. Serve your cool cocktail with an olive or a twist of lemon peel
fields.ingredients_three: olive or lemon peel, to garnish
fields.instructions_one: Stir the vodka, dry vermouth and a little ice together or put them in a cocktail shaker to combine.
fields.instructions_two: Strain into a chilled martini glass. Serve with an olive on a cocktail stick or a twist of lemon peel.

fields.name: Jessica rabbit cocktail
fields.description: Plenty of fresh ingredients lift this simple mezcal cocktail to create a sweet, light and wonderfully balanced drink
fields.ingredients_two: 2 cherry tomatoes, plus 1 extra, to garnish
fields.instructions_one: Put the strawberries, tomatoes, agave and lime juice in the bottom of a cocktail shaker and muddle together. Add the mezcal, tequila and pineapple juice and fill with ice.
fields.instructions_two: Shake hard to create a nice foam head on the drink and fine strain into a martini glass or coupette. Garnish with a mint sprig inserted into a cherry tomato.

fields.name: Sidecar
fields.description: Try your hand at recreating a classic 1920s cocktail, the sidecar. It's easy to adapt – simply use cognac, or go with equal parts cognac, triple sec and lemon juice
fields.instructions_one: Put a coupe glass in the fridge to chill. Tip all of the ingredients into a cocktail shaker.
fields.instructions_two: Shake well, until the outside of the shaker feels cold, then strain the cocktail into the chilled glass. If the lemon juice is too sharp, add the bitters to taste.

fields.name: Easy bloody mary
fields.description: Mix together tomato juice, amontillado sherry, vodka and sherry vinegar to make a bloody mary cocktail. Season to suit with Tabasco and Worcestershire sauce
fields.ingredients_three: 2 tbsp amontillado sherry, squeeze of lemon juice
fields.ingredients_four: 1 tsp sherry vinegar , or to taste
fields.ingredients_five: pinch celery salt, Worcestershire sauce , to taste
fields.instructions_one: Put the ice in a tall glass. Pour over the tomato juice, vodka, amontillado and sherry vinegar. Stir in the celery salt, then season to taste with the Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco and lemon juice. Taste again to see if more sherry vinegar is needed.
fields.instructions_two: Serve with celery sticks, lemon wedges and a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper, if you like.

fields.name: Hugo cocktail
fields.description: Refreshing, floral and herbal, the hugo cocktail is perfect for warm summer evenings. Make this simple spritz with prosecco and a dash of gin
fields.ingredients_one: small handful of mint leaves, plus 1 mint sprig to garnish
fields.instructions_one: Gently scrunch the mint in your hands to lightly bruise it, then put in the bottom of a large wine glass. Pour over the elderflower cordial and gin and leave to infuse for 1-2 mins.
fields.instructions_two: Fill the glass with ice, then pour over the soda water and prosecco. Stir gently to combine. Garnish with the lime wedge and mint sprig before serving.

fields.name: Mango & pineapple mojito
fields.description: Give your favourite classic cocktail a tropical twist with our mango and pineapple mojito. This vibrant, fruity drink is perfect for summer party season
fields.instructions_one: Tip the pineapple, mango, limes and sugar into a large jug and muddle together. Bruise and add the mint leaves, then top with ice. Stir in the white rum, pineapple rum and sparkling water.

fields.name: Strawberry mojito
fields.description: Mix up a refreshing strawberry mojito to sip in the summer sun. This easy, fruity cocktail is perfect for barbecue season or a relaxed party with friends
fields.instructions_one: Muddle the strawberries, limes and sugar in a large jug. Bruise the mint leaves and add to the jug with a pinch of black pepper. Add lots of ice and stir in the rum and sparkling water.
